revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

{{Taxobox | image=Lepiota subincarnata 117620.jpg | image_width=234px | regnum = [[Fungus|Fungi]] | divisio = [[Basidiomycota]] | classis = [[Agaricomycetes]] | ordo = [[Agaricales]] | familia = [[Agaricaceae]] | genus = ''[[Lepiota]]'' | species = '''''L. subincarnata''''' | binomial = ''Lepiota subincarnata'' | binomial_authority = [[Jakob Emanuel Lange|J.E.Lange]] (1940) | synonyms_ref = | synonyms = *''Lepiota josserandii'' [[Marcel Bon|Bon]] & Boiffard (1975)
*''Lepiota josserandii'' var. ''rosabrunnea'' Raithelh. (1988) *''Leucoagaricus josserandii'' (Bon & Boiffard) Raithelh. (1989) *''Leucoagaricus rosabrunneus'' (Raithelh.) Raithelh. (1989) *''Lepiota subincarnata'' var. ''josserandii'' (Bon & Boiffard) Gminder (1999) }} {{mycomorphbox |name=''Lepiota subincarnata'' |whichGills=free |capShape=convex |capShape2=flat |hymeniumType=gills |stipeCharacter=ring |ecologicalType=mycorrhizal |sporePrintColor=white |howEdible=deadly }} '''''Lepiota subincarnata''''' is a gilled [[mushroom]] of the genus ''[[Lepiota]]'' in the order [[Agaricales]]. It is known to contain [[amatoxin]]s and consuming this fungus can be potentially lethal. First [[species description|described]] scientifically by the Danish mycologist [[Jakob Emanuel Lange]] in 1940, the species is found in Asia, Europe, and North America. Bon and Boiffard described ''Lepiota josserandii'' in 1974, which turned out to be the same species. ==See also== {{Portal|Fungi}} *[[List of deadly fungi]] * [[List of Lepiota species|List of ''Lepiota'' species]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite book |author=Hall IR. |title=Edible and Poisonous Mushrooms of the World |publisher=Timber Press |location=Portland, Oregon |year=2003 |page=107 |isbn=0-88192-586-1}} {{cite book |title=Flora Agaricina Danica |volume=5 |year=1940 |author=Lange JE.}} {{cite journal |vauthors=Razaq A, Vellinga EC, Ilyas S, Khalid AN |title=''Lepiota brunneoincarnata'' and ''L. subincarnata'': distribution and phylogeny |journal=Mycotaxon |year=2013 |volume=126 |pages=133–41 |doi=10.5248/126.133}} {{cite web |url=http://www.mycobank.org/MycoTaxo.aspx?Link=T&Rec=299506 |title=''Lepiota subincarnata'' J.E. Lange 1940 |publisher=International Mycological Association |work=MycoBank |accessdate=2010-12-22}} }} ==External links== *{{IndexFungorum|299506}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q4259141}} [[Category:Lepiota|subincarnata]] [[Category:Deadly fungi]] [[Category:Fungi of Asia]] [[Category:Poisonous fungi]] [[Category:Fungi of Europe]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1940]] {{Agaricaceae-stub}}
